content:
If I am making changes to org.hl7.fhir.core, and these changes are limited to code under r5, is it reasonable to use mvn install -rf :org.hl7.fhir.r5 as my build command to avoid rebuilding parts that are (presumably) not affected by my changes?
@Mark Iantorno

So, yes that should work. However when you're making changes to any models or any of the files in r5 you should really run the full test suite to see if it affects the validation or conversion packages in any way
If you just want to quickly iterate on changes that you're making in that package it's fine though
At the end of the day it's going to get run when you try to merge anyway.
Vassil Peytchev has marked this topic as resolved.
